title: Black Hole Entropy, Entanglement, and Holography
abstract: We show that the entanglement between inner and outer particles, with respect to the event horizon, is the microscopic origin of the black hole entropy. Due to the non-unitarity of the mapping between the vacua in the flat and the curved frames, this entanglement is very robust. The holographic nature of the entropy is recovered in a quantum field theoretical setting, and it is shown that, at microscopic level, the responsible for the dimensional reduction of the degrees of freedom is the Hawking effect.
